cab.content: confidential this DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HER BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the Cabinet. October 1958C (58) 225 Copy No.28th October, 1958CABINETPRIVILEGES OF INTERNATIONAL ORGANISATIONS : THEINTERNATIONAL SUGAR council memorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign AffairsThe United Kingdom delegation to the International Sugar Conference nowin session in Geneva has been invited to accept a minor amendment to the present international Sugar Agreement, 1953 (Command 9815), which proposes that theword " funds " in Article 38(6) shall be replaced by the words " assets, income andother property." The only practical effect of this amendment will be to confer onthe International Sugar Council partial exemption from municipal rates similarto that already accorded to the International Tin Council (and to many other international organisations), but a new Order in Council will be required to giveeffect to the amendment and to enable Her Majesty's Government to accept that part of the Agreement.2. As the matter is very urgent the United Kingdom delegation has been authorised to accept the amendment, which will in due course be signed " subject to ratification."3. The implications of the proposal have been discussed by Departments anda draft of an Order in Council has been prepared accordingly.4. I therefore seek the approval of my colleagues of the action already taken and proposed, and for the submission to them and to Parliament in due course ofa draft Order in Council which will revoke and replace the existing Order(1954/1473).S. L.Foreign Office, S.W.1,27th October, 1958.54242
